title: Doppler - students move toward at v and away at 2v

content.question: A stationary siren emits a periodic sound of constant frequency <math alttext="f sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>f</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>. Student <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> is moving toward the siren at a constant speed <math alttext="v" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>v</mi></math> and observes a frequency <math alttext="f sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>f</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>. Student <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> is moving away from the siren at a constant speed <math alttext="2 v" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mi>v</mi></math> and observes a frequency <math alttext="f sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>f</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>. Which of the following correctly compares the frequencies <math alttext="f sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>f</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>, <math alttext="f sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>f</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>, and <math alttext="f sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>f</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="f sub 0, end sub, equals, f sub 1, end sub, which equals, f sub 2, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>f</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>f</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>f</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="f sub 1, end sub, is greater than, f sub 0, end sub, which is greater than, f sub 2, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>f</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>f</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>f</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="f sub 2, end sub, is greater than, f sub 1, end sub, which is greater than, f sub 0, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>f</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>f</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>f</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="f sub 2, end sub, is greater than, f sub 0, end sub, which is greater than, f sub 1, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>f</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>f</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>f</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="f sub 1, end sub, is greater than, f sub 0, end sub, which is greater than, f sub 2, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>f</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>f</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>f</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
